dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Jim Cramer on Apple Inc. (AAPL): ‘We Sold Some Stock Because It Became Too Big A Part Of Our Portfolio’
News Content: We recently published an article titled Jim Cramer Discusses These 18 Stocks & President Trump's $500 Billion AI Plan.In this article, we are going to take a look at where Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) stands against the other stocks Jim Cramer recently discussed.

In his latest appearance on CNBC's Squawk on the Street, Jim Cramer had a lot to say about a lot of stocks. Along with stocks, he was also full of comments about the new Trump administration and how it's different from the previous one. Cramer shared, "If you go back over the councils that were disbanded post-Charlottesville, what you would see are a lot of traditional industrialists and drug companies." According to him, "These were the people that were not drawn to, by Elon Musk. Elon Musk has changed the equation" to increase the role that technology companies and executives are playing this time around.

Commenting further on Musk, Cramer shared, "Now, by the way, there's a lot of talk now about where is Elon Musk?" This means wondering where he is "in terms of having people in powerful positions say, in the Defense Department." Cramer believes that Musk "doesn't seem to have them" and added, "If Musk wants to be meaningful, I don't want a seat at the table, I want a table."

The CNBC host also mentioned some industries that will benefit from AI. As part of a discussion about the returns from the multiple billions of dollars that firms have invested into AI, Cramer cautioned not to "forget healthcare." He believes "Healthcare's gonna be a very big, very big part of AI. David, it's not yet. And we need that, well-meaning people who believe in the industry have to have what people who are more than just trying to figure out how to make it so there's a call center that's better."

Cramer also shared his thoughts about the breadth of market performance during the day. While markets were rising, he noted, "Yet the S&P oscillator I follow, [inaudible] is slightly overbought, there's a lot more room." Cramer believes "there's a considerable part of the market that has done nothing. Nothing for years. And that's coming on." He doesn't like small-cap stocks either. "And I'm not a small cap aficionado," Cramer commented. He believes, "That stuff doesn't work. People always try to chin that up. And then somebody sells a big small cap derivative." The host added that instead of small-cap stocks, he likes "companies that frankly, what we, you know we didn't think all that much of the second tier tech companies that are really taking off. The semis that haven't done anything lately."

Story Continues

As for President Trump, Cramer believes that he needs to look at insurance costs that affect a large number of Americans. According to him:

"The President has to take a look at these issues. Because this is where the, the copay, your insurance, your group insurance, your property, casualty insurance. That's where the President's going to put it. If he wants to put a stake in the inflation. He goes after the pharmacy benefits managers."

Our Methodology

To make our list of the stocks that Jim Cramer talked about, we listed down all the stocks he mentioned during CNBC’s Squawk on the Street aired on January 22nd.

For these stocks, we also mentioned the number of hedge fund investors. Why are we interested in the stocks that hedge funds invest in? The reason is simple: our research has shown that we can outperform the market by imitating the top stock picks of the best hedge funds. Our quarterly newsletter’s strategy selects 14 small-cap and large-cap stocks every quarter and has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150 percentage points. (see more details here).Is Apple Inc. (AAPL) The Best Bear Market Stock To Invest In Now?

A wide view of an Apple store, showing the range of products the company offers.

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL)

Number of Hedge Fund Holders In Q3 2024: 158

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) has been a regular feature of Cramer's morning appearances this year. He believes that investors who evaluate the stock primarily through the lens of China smartphone sales are missing the broader picture. Cramer also dismissed Mark Zuckberberg's comments in Joe Rogan's podcast which claimed that innovation had stopped at Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) since Tim Cook took cover. More recently, he believes that the firm will post disappointing quarter results. Here is what he said:

"I said last night it's going to miss. We sold some stock because it became too big a part of our portfolio. I think it's going lower, I think they'll miss the quarter. I think there's another two or three analysts are going to try to downgrade it ahead of time. So they can upgrade it after they report the quarter. I do think it's a longer term, the stock is up thousands of percent since every single time it gets downgraded people sell it. That's all I'm saying. That's all I'm saying."

Overall AAPL ranks 3rd on our list of the stocks Jim Cramer recently discussed. While we acknowledge the potential of AAPL as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and doing so within a shorter time frame. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than AAPL but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.

READ NEXT: 20 Best AI Stocks To Buy Now and Complete List of 59 AI Companies Under $2 Billion in Market Cap

Disclosure: None. This article is originally published at Insider Monkey.

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news highlights Jim Cramer's concerns about Apple Inc. potentially missing its quarterly results and his decision to reduce exposure to the stock, suggesting a bearish outlook. Historically, downgrades and concerns about company performance can negatively impact stock prices. Furthermore, the inclusion of AI stocks in discussions may create a shift in investor interest away from AAPL towards those perceived as having higher potential returns. These factors lead to an increased probability of AAPL's stock price falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news headline highlights Warren Buffett's significant investment in Apple. Buffett's investment decisions are widely followed and respected, often signaling a positive outlook on the company's future. The headline's phrasing, 'Is It a Buy Now?', directly implies that the stock is worth considering for investment. While the article itself would need to contain a deeper analysis, the headline's tone is generally positive. Therefore, this news is more likely to encourage buying pressure than selling pressure, leading to a higher probability of a price increase. We are assigning probabilities based on the headline alone. A full article analysis would be needed for greater accuracy.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: Jim Cramer, a well-known financial commentator, announced that he sold some of his Apple stock because of its large portfolio weighting.  While he anticipates Apple missing earnings and predicts further downgrades before an eventual upgrade, he also notes the stock's history of rising after downgrades. His statement reflects a portfolio management decision rather than a definitive negative outlook on the company's long-term prospects. The article also highlights other AI-related stocks as potentially more promising investment opportunities in the near term. Therefore, the impact of this news on Apple's stock price is likely to be muted, although slightly leaning towards a downward trend in the short term due to the immediate sell-off by a prominent investor and anticipated earnings miss.  The long-term outlook is less affected by this single piece of news.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news highlights several key factors that could influence Apple Inc.'s stock price: 1) Positive market momentum, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite rallying, particularly in tech stocks. 2) Apple's upcoming earnings report, which is part of a broader 'Magnificent Seven' tech earnings wave expected to show strong growth. 3) A favorable environment for tech due to Trump's $500 billion AI investment announcement, which has already boosted related stocks. 4) The Federal Reserve's expected decision to hold rates steady, reducing near-term uncertainty. However, potential risks include: 1) Any unexpected negative earnings surprises from Apple or peers. 2) Fed Chair Powell's press conference comments, which could introduce volatility. Overall, the bullish trends in tech and positive earnings expectations outweigh the risks.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article highlights Apple's commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) practices, despite facing challenges from conservative groups. The company has asked investors to vote down a shareholder proposal that aims to assess risks of its DEI programs. This demonstrates Apple's dedication to its values and culture. Given the current market trends and societal pressures, Apple's stance on DEI may be viewed positively by investors who prioritize environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors. However, there is also a risk that conservative groups and investors may react negatively to Apple's decision. Overall, the news is likely to have a neutral to slightly positive impact on Apple's stock price.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The financial news covers multiple aspects affecting the market, including Big Tech earnings reports, a scheduled Federal Reserve meeting, and political developments under Trump's administration. For Apple Inc. (AAPL), it's noted that several Big Tech companies including Apple will release earnings, potentially impacting the stock price. While the recent market rally and positive economic indicators could support bullish sentiment, upcoming earnings and central bank decisions can introduce volatility.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The news highlights Jim Cramer's concerns over Apple potentially missing its quarterly earnings, alongside his decision to reduce his stock holdings. This suggests a bearish outlook for the company in the short term. Additionally, the mention of AI stocks as potentially more promising investments indicates a shift in investor focus away from AAPL. Despite some positive market trends and Apple's strong brand, the immediate impact of Cramer's comments and the expected earnings miss likely outweigh these factors, leading to a greater probability of a stock price decline.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news headline is primarily positive, focusing on Warren Buffett's large investment in Apple. Buffett's investment is generally seen as a strong endorsement. However, the phrasing "Is It a Buy Now?" suggests that the article itself might explore both positive and negative aspects, as it's a question rather than a statement. Considering other models' previous round predictions, there's a spread of opinions, and some noted risks like investor sentiment shifting away from AAPL. This suggests the real impact will depend on sub factors. In this round I try to give a somewhat average view.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: Jim Cramer's statement about selling some Apple stock due to portfolio rebalancing is the most impactful piece of information in this news. While he expresses concerns about Apple missing earnings, this seems secondary to his portfolio management decision.  His prediction of future downgrades followed by upgrades is consistent with AAPL's historical price behavior and doesn't provide a strong signal for the short-term price movement.  The other aspects of the article (AI focus, general market trends) are less directly relevant to Apple's immediate price movement than Cramer's actions.  Considering the past predictions, there is a wide range of views, highlighting the uncertainty surrounding AAPL's short-term future, with many being cautiously bearish.  Based on Cramer's sales alone, the probability of the stock falling should be higher than rising, but the fact that this is related to portfolio management, not necessarily negative sentiment towards Apple directly, tempers this prediction.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news highlights several factors that could influence Apple Inc.'s stock price: 1) Positive market momentum, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite rallying, particularly in tech stocks. 2) Apple's upcoming earnings report, which is part of a broader 'Magnificent Seven' tech earnings wave expected to show strong growth. 3) A favorable environment for tech due to Trump's $500 billion AI investment announcement, which has already boosted related stocks. 4) The Federal Reserve's expected decision to hold rates steady, reducing near-term uncertainty. However, potential risks include: 1) Any unexpected negative earnings surprises from Apple or peers. 2) Fed Chair Powell's press conference comments, which could introduce volatility. Overall, the bullish trends in tech and positive earnings expectations outweigh the risks.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) practices, despite facing challenges from conservative groups. The company has asked investors to vote down a shareholder proposal that aims to assess risks of its DEI programs. This demonstrates Apple's dedication to its values and culture. Given the current market trends and societal pressures, Apple's stance on DEI may be viewed positively by investors who prioritize environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors. However, there is also a risk that conservative groups and investors may react negatively to Apple's decision. Overall, the news is likely to have a neutral to slightly positive impact on Apple's stock price.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article highlights Apple's commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) practices, despite facing challenges from conservative groups. This demonstrates Apple's dedication to its values and culture. Given the current market trends and societal pressures, Apple's stance on DEI may be viewed positively by investors who prioritize environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors. However, there is also a risk that conservative groups and investors may react negatively to Apple's decision. The fact that other prominent companies, such as Costco, are also defending their DEI practices suggests a trend of companies standing firm on their values, which could lead to a positive market reaction. Considering the previous predictions, there is a range of opinions, but the overall trend seems to be neutral to slightly positive. Therefore, the news is likely to have a neutral to slightly positive impact on Apple's stock price.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The financial news covers multiple aspects affecting the market, including Big Tech earnings reports, a scheduled Federal Reserve meeting, and political developments under Trump's administration. For Apple Inc. (AAPL), it's noted that several Big Tech companies including Apple will release earnings, potentially impacting the stock price. While the recent market rally and positive economic indicators could support bullish sentiment, upcoming earnings and central bank decisions can introduce volatility. Additionally, there are mixed signals from different predictions provided by other models, indicating varying degrees of confidence. Considering these factors, the probability of both a rise and fall in stock price appears balanced.

Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The financial news indicates Mac Cramer's concerns about Apple Inc. potentially missing its quarterly earnings, which combined with his decision to reduce his exposure to the stock suggests a bearish short-term outlook. Historical precedence shows that comments from prominent investors like Cramer can influence market sentiment, leading to potential stock price declines. While there are overall positive market trends affecting tech stocks, the negative commentary and anticipated earnings miss create stronger downward pressure on Apple's stock. Therefore, I estimate a higher probability of a price decline over an increase.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.62, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.38, Reasoning: The headline focuses on Warren Buffett's substantial investment in Apple, which generally signals confidence and a positive outlook. This could attract other investors and drive up demand. However, the 'Is It a Buy Now?' phrasing suggests the article may contain balanced viewpoints, potentially addressing risks or downsides. Reviewing the previous rounds' predictions, there's a wide range, reflecting differing interpretations of Apple's prospects and external market factors. Given Buffett's influence, a positive initial reaction is likely, but the article's detailed content (which is not available) will ultimately determine the sustainable impact. Considering this and aiming for a more moderate prediction compared to the initial enthusiasm, a slightly higher probability is given to a stock price increase.

While he anticipates an earnings miss and potential downgrades, he also acknowledges Apple's historical tendency to rebound after such events. This creates uncertainty.  The differing predictions from various AI models further highlight the ambiguity of the situation.  Some models focus on the positive market momentum, while others emphasize Cramer's sell-off and the potential shift towards AI stocks. The lack of overwhelmingly negative news, coupled with the overall market trends and the potential for a post-downgrade rally, prevents a strongly bearish prediction.  The portfolio rebalancing aspect mitigates the impact of Cramer's opinion, suggesting a more neutral outlook compared to a purely negative interpretation of his statement.

Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{

"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]",

}
